fields.description:
In the backlog, we can drag-and-drop backlog items to sort them into an order of high priority items at the top and low priority items at the bottom.  Great.  We can then start a sprint and see all the items' cards in the *To Do* column of the Active Sprint board and, thankfully, the cards are in the same order: high priority at the top, low at the bottom.  Great.

(Jira's "ranking" or "rank" is what I mean by "priority.")

But as soon as work starts and cards start moving across the columned Active Sprint (or Kanban) board, the visibility of the priority is lost.  When a card is moved into a column, the card floats upwards with utter disregard for our decision of its importance.  A low-priority card can appear _above_ a second-highest priority card just by being in a different column.

I am aware of one work-around with which we can maintain the visibility of the backlog's order-of-priority on the Active Sprint board, but its cost far outweighs its benefit.

Is there a(nother) way of maintaining the backlog's order-of-priority on the Active Sprint board?

 

*Currently Jira works like this:*

Immediately after starting the sprint, I can see that the Frame is more important that the Horn.
||To Do||Step 1||Step 2||Step 3||Step 4||Done||
|Frame| | | | | |
|Wheels| | | | | |
|Pedals| | | | | |
|Handlebar| | | | | |
|Horn| | | | | |

A few days into the sprint, which is the most important thing?  It's impossible to discern.  It looks like all items are at the same level of importance.
||To Do||Step 1||Step 2||Step 3||Step 4||Done||
|Frame| Wheels| Handlebar| Pedals|Horn| |

 

*Better would be:*
 A few days into the sprint, we can see that the least important thing is nearly, but the most important hasn't started yet!
||To Do||Step 1||Step 2||Step 3||Step 4||Done||
|Frame| | | | | |
| | Wheels| | | | |
| | | | Pedals| | |
| | | Handlebar| | | |
| | | | | Horn| |

 

 ([The work-around|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-swimlanes-764478010.html]: configure the board to have swimlanes based on Stories; then, because the backlog-items are now represented on the board not by cards but by swimlane-headers, we need to give each backlog item a sub-task; then drag not any backlog-item cards across the board, but rather drag the items' sub-tasks' cards.  Benefit: we maintain the visibility of backlog's order-of-priority. Cost:  valuable information hitherto visible on the backlog items' cards is hidden when cards are replaced with swimlane headers; also, that's a lot of otherwise unbeneficial Jira sub-tasks to create, keep track of, and close in addition to the backlog items themselves.)

 

I'm using Jira version 8.4.0.
fields.summary: Maintain cards' ranking or vertical-position as they move across the board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian,

I've been a fan of your tools for the last decade, and regard very positively the evolution in the products and growth of you offers.

However, the matching users licence policy is now completely outdate, and I strongly suggest you review it. Given the number of plugins for JIRA available, it happens quite often that we would like to start using a given plugin for on of our company's divisions only, limiting the licence (and price) of the plugin.

Due to your matching licences policy, this is not possible, which many times stops us from getting additional products complementing your tools.

IMHO, one of the main reasons for Atlassian's products success is the highly flexible and usable User Management approach, but oddly enough, the matching licences policy is a big obstacle to going deeper into the Atlassian ecosystem.

I therefore suggest you implement a more flexible licensing policy, where the system admin can 1) choose a sub-set of users from JIRA licence which have access to a given plugin, or 2) select all users if the licences match.
fields.summary: Drop matching licences policy asap, please!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira's DVCS GitHub connector uses the "access_token" query parameter which is now a deprecated authentication method for the GitHub API

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira Administration > Application > DVCS Accounts
 # Click on "Link Bitbucket Cloud and GitHub accounts" button
 # Provide details for GitHub (check screen shot) and proceed. 
!Screenshot 2020-02-05 at 5.54.38 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 # Make sure that Jira syncs this GitHub data at least once

h3. Expected Results
The integration works without any problems.

h3. Actual Results
GitHub is currently emailing administrators to inform them that they have an integration that is using this deprecated authentication method. The message looks like this:
{quote}
Hi,

On February 4th, 2020 at 14:01 (UTC) your application (JIRA DVCS) used an access token (with the User-Agent Java/1.8.0_151) as part of a query parameter to access an endpoint through the GitHub API:

[https://api.github.com/repositories/229755391/hooks]

Please use the Authorization HTTP header instead as using the `access_token` query parameter is deprecated.

Depending on your API usage, we'll be sending you this email reminder once every 3 days for each token and User-Agent used in API calls made on your behalf.
Just one URL that was accessed with a token and User-Agent combination will be listed in the email reminder, not all.

Visit [https://developer.github.com/changes/2019-11-05-deprecated-passwords-and-authorizations-api/#authenticating-using-query-parameters] for more information.

Thanks,
The GitHub Team{quote}


h3. Notes
* Related announcement from _2020-02-10_  - https://developer.github.com/changes/2020-02-10-deprecating-auth-through-query-param/
bq. All authentication using query parameters will return a status code of 401 like all other auth failures starting on:  November _13, 2020_ at 4:00 PM UTC
bq. This deprecation has *not* been applied to GitHub Enterprise offerings yet. 
* Related announcement from _2020-02-14_ - https://developer.github.com/changes/2020-02-14-deprecating-oauth-app-endpoint/
bq. All calls to the old version of the OAuth application endpoints will return a status code of 404 starting on:  _May 5, 2021_ at 4:00 PM UTC
bq. This deprecation has *not* been applied to GitHub Enterprise offerings yet. 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Jira's DVCS GitHub connector uses the "access_token" query parameter which is a deprecated authentication method for the GitHub API

fields.description:
h2. Problem summary

Currently a user directory can only be configured to accept one base DN for users, and one base DN for users. If users or groups (that are relevant to JIRA) exist in multiple containers/OUs of the LDAP structure, then the base DN has to be set wide enough so that both OUs are in the scope of the search. This can cause too many irrelevant groups to be pulled into JIRA, which in turn leads to performance issues or complexity in maintaining user management. Also if you'd like to assume memberships from a different OU, it's nearly impossible with AD. 
h2. Example

For example: consider the case where we have the following LDAP structure, for simplicity's sake we're only looking for groups right now and not users:
{code:java}
DC=company,DC=com
  +--- OU=all_groups
         +--- OU=amer_groups
         +--- OU=apac_groups
         +--- OU=50k_other_irrelevant_groups
{code}
If we want to pull in the groups under {{amer_groups}} and {{apac_groups}}, then the group base DN must be set to {{"OU=all_groups,DC=company,DC=com}}" since both of of them are under that common OU.

The problem is, doing so will also pull the other 50k groups we don't care about into JIRA, because that's also within the search scope. For some LDAP implementations, this is not a problem because you can exclude those irrelevant groups by using [Extensible Matching|https://ldapwiki.willeke.com/wiki/ExtensibleMatch] in a search filter to target groups that are within specific OUs. However some LDAP implementations, most notably Microsoft Active Directory, do [not support this type of filtering|https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc223241.aspx], and therefore JIRA will have no choice but to pull in all of the groups.

And you can't add another connector to the same directory as Jira will only sync memberships of the directory that is in the highest order. 
h2. Proposed solution

It would be ideal if JIRA itself can allow a single directory to search for users/groups from multiple DNs, regardless of the AD/LDAP implementation.
fields.summary: Support Mulitple base DNs for group filters in JIRA connectors

h3. Issue Summary
When you transition the issue from one column to the other (without clicking the issue to open the issue details on the right-side panel), the comment textbox is not Wiki style formatted

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any Kanban/Scrum board
# Make sure that the destination column/status in the workflow has a Transition view
# Drag the issue to the destination column/status. Don't click the issue as it will open the issue details on the right-side panel. In this way, the issue won't be replicated.
# When the transition screen pops out, notice the comment textbox

h3. Expected Results
The comment box is in Wiki style format
!wiki.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The comment textbox is in plain/rich style format
!rich.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Click on the issue to display the issue details before dragging the issue. 

h3. Notes
* This has also been observed in Attachment field.
fields.summary: Dragging an issue in the board with a Transition screen shows Rich text formatted comment box

fields.description: I am creating this feature request as JSWSERVER-12016 was closed without providing an actual solution to the problem. In an organisation that has hundreds of projects, the number of epics gets large. When I create an issue in my project, I would like to only see the epics and sprints in my project. I understand that other users may have a need to manage epics at a cross project level, but I should still be able to configure my project or my board to show me only the stuff I want to see at issue creation time. I currently have to create issues and than use drag and drop in the backlog view to assign them to epics and sprints. This makes creating issues in Jira a bit of a pain.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a Version Report Gadget is initially added to a dashboard, it's configuration will default to selecting the first board available to the user. This means that the first thing that the gadget does is immediately load a list of versions from that Board.

This calculation itself may take a long time, particularly in larger instances with significant amounts of data, or for Boards that have a large number of versions and issues within them. During this time, the gadget remains unresponsive until the list of versions is calculated, or until the gadget times out (which takes 5 seconds by default; see [JIRA gadget timeout value|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-gadget-timeout-value-966033530.html]).

This behavior results in unnecessary load on the Jira server, and the user is unable to actually configure the gadget as desired until the initial version load is complete. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
The gadget should not select a board by default, as the initial board may not even be the one that the user wanted.
fields.summary: Adding a Version Report Gadget should not load a board by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Move to Done" displays incorrectly on boards when using IE 11 browser.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Move issue A to the done status at the top row on a test board
 * Move issue B (which has one or more subtasks) to the second row on the test board
 * Move all subtasks of issue B from "In Progress" to "Done" on the test board
 * Press cancel when prompted with the message:
{code:xml}
All sub-tasks for parent issue B-##### are now Done.
Do you want to update this parent issue to match?
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The "Move to Done" option displays clearly in the selected row when viewed from Chrome, Firefox, Internet Explorer, and Safari.

!chrome.png|thumbnail!

(i) This example was collected from Chrome. 
h3. Actual Results

The "Move to Done" option displays incorrectly, overlaying issues in the same column placed above it when viewed from Internet Explorer.

!IE.png|thumbnail!


 (i) This behavior was reproduced the following versions of Internet Explorer:
 * 11.1565.16299.0
 * 11.1184.17134.0

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: "Move to Done" displays incorrectly on boards when using IE 11 browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As Lexorank rebalance is a single-threaded background task, it can take some time to complete. 

While this is by design to avoid Jira performance impact, it would be useful for admins to be able to dedicate more system resources to complete the Lexorank rebalance faster. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Admins have the ability to increase threads used for reindexing as noted in:

[Increase speed of reindexing in Jira Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/increase-speed-of-reindexing-in-jira-server-826879636.html]

Allow for the same ability to dedicate more threads for Lexorank rebalancing would be useful.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like options to speed up a Lexorank rebalance.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Version Fields (AffectedVersion/FixVersion) would allow us to select Already Archived versions if the issue view page or Edit Page is loaded *before* the deletion and is *not* refreshed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have the {{[http://JIRA-URL/browse/Issue-key|http://jira-url/browse/Issue-key]}} page open in one tab
 # Archive an existing version:
!Version_Archived.png|thumbnail!
 # You can still select the Archived version in AffectedVersion/FixVersion field
!Allowing_to_update_issue_with_Archived_version.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

Even though the page shows the Version which is now archived (Since the page is loaded *before* the version was archived), once trying to save it should prompt an error saying "Version is already archived" or similar
h3. Actual Results

Jira still allows us to update the issue with an Archived version
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page is the only workaround available.
 (flag) The concern is users might not be aware whether a version is already archived while having the issue view/edit screen opened and since Jira allows you to still update the issue with the archived version, this can cause trouble.
fields.summary: Jira allows issues to be updated with Archived Version until page is refreshed

Lead and Description columns in Project Components page are overlapping. 
Behaviour is not observed with Jira 7.13 release.
Same behaviour is observed across Chrome and FireFox browsers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with a substantial longer full name
# Create a Software project
# Navigate to the Software project >> Components page
# Create a new component with the new user created in Step 1 as Lead with a description

h3. Expected Results
All the columns are displayed accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
The values in Lead and Description columns are overlapping:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-10 at 2.29.29 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Impose word wrap to the Lead column by adding the following to the *Jira Administration >> System >> Announcement banner* or appending to the existing Announcement banner:
{code}
<style>
table.components-table td.components-table__lead {
	white-space:normal;
}
</style>
{code}
fields.summary: Lead and Description columns in Project Components page are overlapping

h3. Issue Summary

A custom logo on a transparent background prevents the workaround in JRASERVER-45829 from working.  Further color customization does not persist. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Upload a new logo with a green, red, gray or any other color background besides blue.
 2. See that the header color and everything changed accordingly.
 3. Upload another new logo with a transparent background instead of the colored background above.
 4. See that the header color probably changed colors again (if it was just transparent and white it will change it back to "default" colors, or if you have any other color in the logo it will change it to that)
 5. Click the Undo button to get back to the colors from the background of the first image.
 6. Notice how the actually visible colors haven't changed, but the color selections in the look and feel section show the colors from before correctly.
 7. Attempting to reset the colors by manually typing in the color codes (the workaround in JRASERVER-45829 ) does not work.
h3. Expected Results

You should be able to modify the colors manually. 
h3. Actual Results

The color selection cannot be modified. 
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

fields.description:
I just spent an hour and a half trying to work out why certain epics weren't displaying in the Epics panel of my backlog.

Most of this time was spent searching here and in the community for "Why aren't my Epics displaying in backlog" or "How to set which Epics appear in the backlog". 

I couldn't find anything that addressed my issue.

Eventually I discovered something I had never known before (I have been using Jira for nearly 10 years) :
 * There are two types of status: *Epic Status* and *Issue Status* and it appears these two are completely unrelated.

That is, if I'm editing an Epic, changing Issue Status has no effect on Epic Status and vice versa.

This is really confusing – especially as Epic Status does not display by default on the Epic Issue edit form. 

Also, if I set the Issue Status of an Epic, shouldn't that set the Epic Status and vice versa?

What is the meaning of Issue Status for an Epic?

This needs to be clarified both on the form itself and in the documentation.
fields.summary: Epic Status vs Issue Status confusing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Lucene statistics for the type of directory {{RAMDirectory}} are written to the Jira log files as {{INFO}} level  when this type of directory is flushed, which generates additional logging for an event that is not expected to be logged at {{INFO}} level.

It was found in the logs files analyzed (please note that this can vary for each deployment) that 25% of the Lucene statistics generated belonged to the flushing of {{RAMDirectory}}.

It is important to note that for any other type of index this log provides valuable statistics which could be use to proactively identify possible index performance degradation. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

There are not steps to reproduce the issue.


h3. Expected Results

Flushing an {{IndexWriter}} of a RAMDirectory should not be logged as {{INFO}} log level, however it could be considered as {{TRACE}} log level instead.

h3. Actual Results

The below log lines appear very often in the Jira log files.
 
{code}
2019-11-12 15:40:17,805 catalina-exec-349 INFO anonymous 940x4070627x10 - [IP Address Sanitized],[IP Address Sanitized] /rest/api/latest/search [c.a.jira.index.MonitoringIndexWriter] [lucene-stats] flush stats: snapshotCount=20049, totalCount=2483576, periodSec=300, flushIntervalMillis=14, indexDirectory=null, indexWriterId=com.atlassian.jira.index.MonitoringIndexWriter@45ea1f81, indexDirectoryId=RAMDirectory@52bedaf6 lockFactory=org.apache.lucene.store.SingleInstanceLockFactory@79461c10

2019-11-12 15:40:17,805 catalina-exec-349 WARN anonymous 940x4070627x10 - [IP Address Sanitized],[IP Address Sanitized] /rest/api/latest/search [c.a.jira.index.MonitoringIndexWriter] Detected frequent flushes (every 14 millis) of lucene index which is below warning limit: jira.index.warn.flush.min.interval.millis=1000 millis. This may affect indexing performance. Please visit https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/w0VwOQ for more information.
{code}

h3. Workaround

Adding and Setting the {{com.atlassian.jira.index.MonitoringIndexWriter}} package log level to {{ERROR}}.

\\
fields.summary: Lucene statistics for RAMDirectory type are logged as INFO level when it is flushed.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to delete a board with more than 2100 card colors will fail throwing the below SQL exception.

{code:title=Excerpt of the SQL exception only showing the "Caused by"}
Caused by: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The incoming request has too many parameters. The server supports a maximum of 2100 parameters. Reduce the number of parameters and resend the request.
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException.makeFromDatabaseError(SQLServerException.java:258)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.getNextResult(SQLServerStatement.java:1535)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerPreparedStatement.doExecutePreparedStatement(SQLServerPreparedStatement.java:467)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerPreparedStatement$PrepStmtExecCmd.doExecute(SQLServerPreparedStatement.java:409)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.TDSCommand.execute(IOBuffer.java:7151)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.executeCommand(SQLServerStatement.java:219)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.executeStatement(SQLServerStatement.java:199)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(SQLServerPreparedStatement.java:356)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:98)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:98)
	at net.java.ao.EntityManager.delete(EntityManager.java:462)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.delete(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:108)
{code}


The issue is caused by the SQL statement prepared by the Jira application and passed to the JDBC driver with a number of parameters higher than its limit of 2100.

A board can be configured in many different ways and one of them is customizing the board's card colors.
The card colors for a board can be organized by issue types, priorities, assignees, or JQL queries as specified in [Customizing cards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/customizing-cards-938845307.html].

If the board's card colors are organized by assignee, a default color will be allocated to each user who is or has been an assignee and there is not limit for it.  Hence, when having a board with a large number of issues (at least 2101), each of those issues having a different assignee and the board configured with {{Card color}} strategy assignee the board will have the same number of card colors as assignees. 

The detailed issue above is considered a bug as the SQL statement issued by the application when trying to delete the card colors for the respective board  can be done in a more efficient way (avoiding to pass a high number of parameters to the JDBC driver.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

{panel:borderColor=#FFE7E7|bgColor=#FFE7E7}
Please note this issue was found in a customer's environment with Microsoft SQL Server as the database server and its respective JDBC driver (with the versions shown below).
{code:title=}
Database-version: 12.00.6329
Database-driver: Microsoft JDBC Driver 6.2 for SQL Server 6.2.1.0
{code}
{panel}

 
# Find a board that has a {{Card colors}} configured by "Assignee" and that has more than 2100 assignees across all issues in the board.
# Try to delete the board through the Jira user interface.
 

h3. Expected Results

To be able to delete a board regardless of the number of card colors or other customizations. 


h3. Actual Results

When trying to delete a board the below error is written to the Jira log file:
{code:title=}
2019-11-12 14:37:36,205 http-nio-8080-exec-15 url:/rest/greenhopp....0/rapidview/10997 username:[SANITIZED] ERROR [SANITIZED] 877x181168x1 1myb450 [IP-SANITIZED],[IP-SANITIZED] /rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidview/10997 [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
    	- name:Microsoft SQL Server
    	- version:12.00.6205
    	- minor version:0
    	- major version:12
    Driver:
    	- name:Microsoft JDBC Driver 6.2 for SQL Server
    	- version:6.2.1.0
    
    com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The incoming request has too many parameters. The server supports a maximum of 2100 parameters. Reduce the number of parameters and resend the request.
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:Microsoft SQL Server
	- version:12.00.6205
	- minor version:0
	- major version:12
Driver:
	- name:Microsoft JDBC Driver 6.2 for SQL Server
	- version:6.2.1.0
com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The incoming request has too many parameters. The server supports a maximum of 2100 parameters. Reduce the number of parameters and resend the request.
{code}




h3. Workaround

There is a way to workaround this issue and delete the board.  Please contact Atlassian Premier Support for the specific details.

\\
fields.summary: Deleting a board with more than 2100 card colors fails with SQL exception

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a custom field is created with 2 different context (one global and one set on a specific project) but the same value is in both context then is not possible to create issue from a board where the filter is set on the value of the custom field which is common in both context

I have been able to reproduce it in Jira 8.5.1 but not in any 7.x.x. The issue is reproducible as well for multiple contexts set on specific and different projects.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field (Select list single choice) called *Team*
 # Create *2 context* for this custom field, one *global* and one *restricted to a specific project TEST*
 # Add the field to the TEST project
 # For the global context add the values *Team A and Team B*
 # For the project context add the values *Team B and Team C*
 !Screenshot 2019-11-12 at 14.29.23.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create a board for the project TEST called TEAM C where the filter set for the board is:
{code:java}
project = DEMO AND Team = "Team C" 
{code}
#Try to create an issue inline from the Board TEAM C. The issue is correctly created with the value Team C in.

 # Create a board for the project TEST called TEAM B where the filter set for the board is:
{code:java}
project = DEMO AND Team = "Team B" 
{code}
#Try to create an issue inline from the Board TEAM B. The issue is created but is not displayed in the board and the following message is displayed:
 !Screenshot 2019-11-12 at 13.05.18.png|thumbnail! 

 # When opening and editing the issue we see that the value of the field Team is set on None.

This is because the in the global context and in the project restricted context the values has the same name and someway overlap
h3. Expected Results

The issue should be created and shown into the board
h3. Actual Results

The issue is created but not shown into the board
h3. Workaround

For now the workaround is to call the value in the restricted to the project context with a similar but not exact name of the other in the global context
fields.summary: error with inline creation of issue from board if multiple context with the same value are set for a custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When connecting Jira to Bitbucket Cloud through DVCS, there is a limitation regarding the number of branches that are retrieved per repository, which is set to 10. This can cause Jira to fail retrieving branches if more than 10 were updated before the sync, causing older branches to not be synchronized.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 11 branches on a repository Bitbucket Cloud
# Synchronize the repository on Jira

h3. Expected Results
All 11 branches will be populated on Jira

h3. Actual Results
Only 10 of them will be populated, while the older branch will not appear.

h3. Workaround
When this happens, the branches that were not synchronized need to be updated on Bitbucket Cloud and then force a synchronization on Jira to ensure they are updated.
fields.summary: DVCS plugin only fetches 10 branches for Bitbucket Cloud

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deleting an empty sprint leads to duplicate, irrelevant errors stuck in the Sprint Report
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sprint
 # Add issues
 # Start sprint
 # Remove all issues
 # Stop sprint
 # Delete sprint
 # Select the sprint in Sprint Report

h3. Expected Results

"The chart cannot be shown because there are no issues." errors automatically disappear from the screen
h3. Actual Results

"The chart cannot be shown because there are no issues." errors remain in the screen even though they refer to the sprint that was deleted, not the "new" one that replaced it in Sprint Report after the deletion.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page
fields.summary: Deleting an empty sprint leads to duplicate, irrelevant errors stuck in the Sprint Report

h3. Summary

_Jira Administration > Applications > DVCS accounts_ shows all repositories/organizations, which cause high CPU usage on browser if user connected with large number of repositories.
h3. Suggestion

Set pagination or "Load More" buttons to reduce browser load without showing all repositories.
h3. Workaround
Update repositories through the API.
h4. Check DVCS status of repositories
 # Grab the repos from JIRA
{code:java}
curl -X GET \
  <base-url>/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repositories \
  -H 'Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4='=
{code}
 # Gather more info based on repository
{code:java}
curl -X POST \
  <base-url>/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repo/<repository-id>/autolink \
  -H 'Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'cache-control: no-cache' \
  -d '{"payload": true}'
{code}

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Certain functionalities in Jira, such as trying to mention users or otherwise typing usernames into user fields, allow Jira to return user suggestions as usernames are being typed out. 

As the searching user types, Jira will use a thread to perform a search against what they've typed and return possible results back to the user. In instances with many users, directories, or nested groups, these searches may be computationally expensive and may run for several seconds in order to return results.

It is possible for the searching user to continue typing and end up making multiple user search requests before the previous requests ever complete and return. Jira will not cancel or otherwise terminate previously ongoing search threads in this case.

The instance may experience high CPU load and thread utilization if too many of these threads are working on these searches concurrently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have many users, groups/nested groups, and directories.
# Attempt to search for a user (i.e. by mentioning or perhaps trying to assign an issue), by typing a character out at a pace of 2-3 characters/second.

h3. Expected Results

Suggested users will be returned, and no other behaviors (high CPU/thread usage) are observed.

h3. Actual Results

Suggested users may be returned, but CPU and thread usage run high. Excessive usage may cause the system to become unresponsive. 

Thread Dumps show many threads like the following, which showcase a user mention being searched against nested groups in this particular example:
{code}"http-nio-8080-exec-20 url:/rest/internal/2/user/mention/search username:" #49 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f8210b43000 nid=0x5d85 runnable [0x00007f810e1e1000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	...
	at com.atlassian.crowd.search.EntityDescriptor.toString(EntityDescriptor.java:103)
	at java.lang.String.valueOf(String.java:2994)
	at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:131)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.search.query.membership.MembershipQuery.(MembershipQuery.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.search.query.membership.GroupMembershipQuery.(GroupMembershipQuery.java:19)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.search.builder.QueryBuilder.createMembershipQuery(QueryBuilder.java:177)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.search.builder.QueryBuilder$PartialMembershipQueryWithNameToMatch.returningAtMost(QueryBuilder.java:285)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.RemoteDirectorySearcher.findNestedGroupMembershipsIncludingGroups(RemoteDirectorySearcher.java:278)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.RemoteDirectorySearcher.findNestedGroupMembershipsOfUser(RemoteDirectorySearcher.java:300)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.RemoteDirectorySearcher.getParentDirectoryEntities(RemoteDirectorySearcher.java:203)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.RemoteDirectorySearcher.getRelatedDirectoryEntities(RemoteDirectorySearcher.java:191)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.RemoteDirectorySearcher.searchNestedGroupRelationships(RemoteDirectorySearcher.java:170)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.searchNestedGroupRelationships(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:750)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.application.SingleDirectorySearchStrategy.searchNestedGroupRelationships(SingleDirectorySearchStrategy.java:71){code}

Access Logs show individual HTTP requests being made for each character typed:
{code}/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?username=j
/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?username=ji
/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?username=jir
/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?username=jira
/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?username=jiraa{code}

h3. Workaround

Reducing the complexity and dataset of users, groups, nested groups, and directories may help reduce the calculation cost and time of these searches.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow administrators to configure the frequency at which the browser may submit search requests.
fields.summary: Searching and Mentioning users may cause performance issues and high CPU load

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing an issue from the Kanban board, I found that some hidden field that I also removed from the viewscreen was still showing in the details (it is not editable though). However, when I open the issue separately I don't see this hidden/removed field (expected behavior). This is reproducible with the system field "Description".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in Kanban Project and add a description to it.
 # In fields' configuration, hide the system field "Description".
 # In screens' configuration, remove the system field "Description" from the list of the fields.
 # Open the issue in the Kanban Board: You'll see the "Description" system field in the issue's details.
 # Click on the issue's link to open the view screen for the issue or browse the issue using the URL: <base_url>/browse/<issue_id>: You'll not see the
 # "Description" system field in the issue's details.

+Screen Configuration+ (I removed the Description field)

!ScreenConfiguration.png|width=248,height=124!

+Field Configuration+ (Description field is hidden)

!FieldsConfiguration.png|width=233,height=126!
h3. Expected Results

Since the system field "Description" was hidden and removed from the view screen, it should not appear in the issue's details when opened from the Kanban board.
h3. Actual Results

The system field "Description" is still showing in the issue's details when opened from the Kanban board.

Attaching screenshots:

+Regular Issue View+

!RegularView.png|width=257,height=125!

+Kanban board View+

!KanbanView.png|width=251,height=136!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Viewing issues from Kanban Board still shows hidden/removed fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63570].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Creating a sub-task using the *actions* drop down under _Issues in Epic_ will link the ticket back to the parent Epic ticket and not the selected issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an _issue in epic_.
 # Click the ⚙️ _Actions_ menu next to the new issue and select _Create sub-task_.
 # The sub-task will be created under the Epic instead of the selected issue.

h3. Expected Results

The sub-task will be created as a child of the issue selected within the epic.
h3. Actual Results

The sub-task is created as a child of the epic.
h3. Workaround
 # Open up the selected issue found under *Issues in Epic* in a new tab
 # Select More → _Create sub-tasks_
fields.summary: Create sub-task: should link new issue to the selected issue not the parent epic

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Required information is missing for setting up a shared home

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Leave CLUSTERED in the configuration unset as the default is false.
 # Set JIRA_SHARED_HOME

h3. Expected Results
Jira will be installed and usable

h3. Actual Results
No software is installed.

h3. Workaround

In the Jira docker, the JIRA_SHARED_HOME
the parameter does not take effect until CLUSTERED = true.

This means that the docker for Jira tries to behave like regular
standalone server, and looks for all folders, that for DC should be under
SHARED_HOME under JIRA_HOME.

Running the container without JIRA_SHARED_HOME and with -v per each folder
in shared to make the docker look for it under the local home (e.g.
/shared/plugins:/var/atlassian/application-data/jira/plugins) does the
trick.
fields.summary: Documentation for Jira Software in a Docker container is missing some information.

fields.description:
If  I try to change the priority scheme of a project the link "View Priority Schemes" 
leads me to the overview of all priority schemes.

To assign my project to a scheme is hard work if you have a lot of projects. and there is the danger that you unselect projects if you make a unhappy click in the monstrous multiselect list. 

My proposal is to introduce directly in project configuration
a select list with the available priority schemes. Same like in any other schema selection like notification scheme or security scheme.
fields.summary: Switch priority scheme directly in project administration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Just because you don't use sprints doesn't mean you don't use estimation (remember, issue count is estimation) to help prioritize and plan your work. I've worked with several teams who want to use story points or tshirt sizing for estimation for prioritization and planning, but for whom sprints just won't work.

If you use epics, even if you don't use sprints, you have identified a large piece of work and have broken it down. It doesn't make sense that you would not want reporting on your progress and the work that is left. Scrum boards allow for progress tracking on epics based off of issue count and time tracking, so why not allow this for Kanban?

Currently I have to advise Kanban teams to make a scrum board just to access these reports or buy an add-on to replicate features that are available out of the box, on a different board type.

Also I have seen several requests that might be similar marked as closed due to low demand, however we can't vote on closed issues. Even if this isn't on the road map, please leave this open so that people who would use these features can vote for it.
fields.summary: Estimation and progress reporting for Kanban epics

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 
Currently, if more than one quick filter is selected when customizing a *Control Chart* report, the JQLs of all selected filters will be combined using AND logic. This often leads to no issues being displayed in the report, as only issues that are returned in all selected filters will be present.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to choose between the *OR* and *AND* operators when selecting more than one quick filter.

h3. Why this is important

This gives more options to users when running this report, allowing more flexibility to manage the data used on it.
fields.summary: When selecting quick filters to be reported on the Control Chart report, users should be able to choose the operator

fields.description: Similar to the way a story can add sub-tasks from within the work item, I would like work items (issues to you, Atlassian) - (BTW, you might want to change the fact that your work items (PBIs) are called issues and issuetypes. Not all work items are issues like a defect. If you are going to become an ALM tool, you'll need to eventually get rid of the fact that Jira started off as a defect tracking tool.), to be able to have Defects (Bugs) created against a work item (issue) so that I don't have to link all the fields in order to track defects against a release, sprint, or product increment. I'm guessing you can automate this, and the question I have is, why would you make it so that one has to? It should be automatically established that if I need to enter a defect against a work item (story, feature, etc.), I can do so with efficiency and ease of use. Make it happen, Atlassian. Thanks.
fields.summary: Need Ability to Add Defect On Work Item

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cannot update timezone data with AdoptOpenJDK
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Try to use Brasilia/São Paulo timezone, they got updated this year and they will not enter on daylight saving time.

Steps that we take when using [oracle jdk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/adjusting-daylight-saving-time-brazil-2019-979408558.html]
 # Stop Jira
 # Replace the joda jar file (download the latest version [here|https://github.com/JodaOrg/joda-time/releases]) at JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib
 # Download tzupdater.jar and run the command (don't forget to run the command below from the same Java path being used by Jira):
 ** sudo java -jar tzupdater.jar -l [https://data.iana.org/time-zones/releases/tzdata2019c.tar.gz]
 # Start the application

h3. Expected Results

Have the timezones updated
h3. Actual Results

Timezones don't update

This can be checked using a custom field for dates and then check the value on the database, any date after "2019-11-03" present the incorrect value on Brasilia timezone
h3. Workaround

Proceed with the KB article, when running tzupdater provide additional option:
 * sudo java -Djava.vendor="Oracle Corporation" -jar tzupdater.jar -v -l [https://data.iana.org/time-zones/releases/tzdata2019c.tar.gz]
fields.summary: Cannot update timezone data with AdoptOpenJDK

        List<String> statusIds = new ArrayList<String>();

            // ignore invalid status IDs here

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Description: 
||As A|Scrum Master using time base story pointing|
||I Want|To be able to add time estimates to sub-tasks|
||So That| - I can more accurately reflect the amount of time each sub-task has remaining
 - I can estimate sub-tasks based on the assignee
 - I don't have to work with parent level tasks when estimating stories|
||I'll Be Happy When| - I can provide a time estimate on a sub-task issue type
 - The parent issue type displays the combined sum of all sub-task estimates + parent issue estimate as a Total value
 - I can report on time estimates down to the sub-task level if required|
h3. Example:

I have a story which is to make a decision. This issue has a sub-task for each team member to investigate, discuss and review final documentation. Each team member wishes to estimate their own time value. As a scrum master I don't want to have to manually calculate this and keep a record of this for later review.
fields.summary: Add time-estimation ability to sub-tasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When somebody edits an issue. The watches get emails for every little change in the issue, that are made by somebody - even if the changes done within some second.

For example:

I'am a watcher.

Somebody changes the issue, in the issue-view (not over the edit button):
 * changes the assignee
 * executes a transition
 * changes the priority
 * adds a label
 * adds a comment

Alls this action are done within 5 Minutes.

Jira now sends me 5 EMails.

 This causes that many users add filter to the e-mail-client to delete JIRA-E-Mails

 

Better would be:

Jira sends EMails sends me one EMail. after the user stops editing the issue for x (i.e. 5) Minutes - and aggregates all these change in one mail.

-> Result receiving only 1 E-Mail for this issue

*or* 

Jira sends a EMail after the first change and send for the next x (i.e. 15) Minutes no more emails for this issue. After this timeout Jira sends an aggregated mail with changes since the last email.

-> Result receiving only 2 E-Mail for this issue

 

*or better a combination of both*

Jira send EMails to the watcher, after the user stop modifying the isuue for x (i.e. 2) minutes ) and send for the next x (i.e. 20) Minutes no more emails for this issue. After this timeout Jira sends an aggregated mail with changes since the last email.

-> Result receiving only 1 EMail (with all changes) for this issue
fields.summary: Aggregate EMail on changing a Issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Many organizations would like to work with remaining estimations at the sub-task level.

The workload by assignee window at the title of the sprint doesn't take into account a (very common) situation where the story has several sub-tasks, each one assigned on a different assignee.

For that case, the workload by assignee is *totally wrong* and doesn't enable easy planning of the sprint. Workaround is to use all kind of dashboard gadgets to calculate the total remaining estimation at the sub-task level, but this is not a very good workaround, since it is separate from the backlog view of the board.

+*Example:*+ 
 * Story A, original estimate 20h, remaining estimate 0h, Assigned on User A
 *     Sub-task A1, original estimate 10h, remaining estimate 12h, assigned on user A
 *     Sub-task A2, original estimate 10h, remaining estimate 15h, assigned on user B

*+Expected result:+*

when viewing the workload by assignee, it should show:
 * User A: Original estimate: 20h, remaining estimate 12h (original estimate should be calculated only from the stories, not the sub-tasks)
 * User B: Original estimate: 0h, remaining estimate 15h (original estimate should be calculated only from the stories, not the sub-tasks)

+*Actual result:*+

when viewing the workload by assignee, it shows: (takes into account only stories, not sub-tasks)
 * User A: Original estimate: 20h, remaining estimate 0h
 * User B: Original estimate: 0h, remaining estimate 0h
fields.summary: Take into Account sub-tasks when calculating the Workload by Assignee

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In reference to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-jira-applications-to-another-server-938846962.html]:

This document only addresses one way of migrating Jira to another server, the "copy over the Jira_home directory from old to new" way.  It includes steps that are not necessary if the customer is installing a fresh instance _and uses that fresh install_ instead of copying the old instance.  

Most importantly, this document is *missing* the step to copy over the Jira_home directory.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-jira-applications-to-another-server-938846962.html]
 # Read the article. 

h3. Expected Results

A clear, numbered, step-by-step explanation of how to migrate the application to a new server.
h3. Actual Results

Unnumbered, conversational, incomplete instructions that only apply to one method, and it is not clearly stated that this applies only to copy/paste Jira_home migrations. 

This is also a very time-intensive method because it tells you to make an xml back as the first step.  That means that Jira has to be shut down for the entirety of the process instead of doing other steps first and _then_ making a backup of the actual data. 
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround, but I would suggest clearly stating +which+ method of migration this applies to (there are multiple methods), and make sure the instructions are complete. 

Please separate the migration and upgrade procedures as well.  We already have upgrade documents, so this should be a +migration only+ document.
fields.summary: Jira Migration Documentation missing steps / unclear

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Focus revert to default tab after inline custom field edit using Rich Text Editor Multiline Text Custom Field in Issue View
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multiline text custom field and set it to Rich Text Editor Renderer
 # Create a multiline text custom field and set it to Wiki Renderer
 # Create another custom field text single line
 # In a project add a second field tab to the Create,Edit and Issue View Screen
 # Add the custom field text single line to the first Tab (Default Tab), and the Wiki Renderer and Rich Text Editor renderer text custom fields to the second tab
 # Create a sample issue for that specific process and populate all three fields (the one in the Default Tab and the other 2 in the 2nd tab).
 # Now in the Issue View switch to the 2nd tab and edit inline the Rich Text Editor renderer multiline text custom field.
 # After publishing the change *The focus will go back to the Default Tab*. That doesn't happen while editing inline the Wiki Renderer multiline text custom field. In that case the focus remain on the 2nd tab.

h3. Expected Results
The focus should remain on the 2nd tab

h3. Actual Results
The focus go back on the 1st tab (default tab)

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Focus revert to default tab after inline custom field edit using Rich Text Editor Multiline Text Custom Field in Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When App (plugin) is starting up, it scans spring annotations for plugin classes. As part of this scanning process, it tries to ensure that these _spring scanner v2.x annotation_ classes are contained only in single jar. Responsible class for this action is {{AtlassianScannerBeanDefinitionParser}}. 

If for some reason plugin can see spring annotations from another plugin that bundled them (_Spring Scanner v2.x_ classes should not be bundled), plugin initialization fails with error:
{code}
2019-10-29 09:33:09,879 ThreadPoolAsyncTaskExecutor::Thread 94 ERROR  /rest/plugins/1.0/available/featured [o.e.g.b.e.i.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor] Unable to create application context for [com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner], unsatisfied dependencies: none org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanDefinitionStoreException: Unexpected exception parsing XML document from URL [bundle://337.0:0/META-INF/spring/plugin-context.xml]; nested exception is java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot execute atlassian-spring-scanner-runtime: plugin has an extra copy of atlassian-spring-scanner-annotation classes, perhaps embedded inside the target plugin 'com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner'; embedding scanner-annotations is not supported since scanner version 2.0. Use 'mvn dependency:tree' and ensure the atlassian-spring-scanner-annotation dependency in your plugin has <scope>provided</scope>, not 'runtime' or 'compile', and you have NO dependency on atlassian-spring-scanner-runtime.
{code}

This affects greenhopper plugin on the following versions
||Jira Version||Is Affected?||
|7.13.9|NO|
|8.0.3|NO|
|8.1.3|NO|
|8.2.5|NO|
|8.3.4|YES|
|8.4.2|YES|
|8.5.0|YES|

h4. Potential Workaround
# For any plugin that failed to start, go to the 'Manage Add-Ons' page in Jira and attempt to manually enable the plugin.
# Re-start Jira, and the race condition may not be triggered

h3. Note
(i) How to find the plugin with {{atlassian-spring-scanner-annotation}}.
# Since Spring Scanner v2 classes should not be bundled, you can find reduce the scope of suspected plugins by running the following on:
#* JARs in the current directory (such as $JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins) as follows:
{code}
for i in *.jar; do unzip -v $i | sed "s/^/$i:/" | grep com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/; done
{code}
In my case, this returns the name of the offending JAR:
{code}
jira-greenhopper-plugin-7.13.0-DAILY20190329134024.jar:       0  Stored        0   0% 08-21-2014 06:30 00000000  com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/
jira-greenhopper-plugin-7.13.0-DAILY20190329134024.jar:     422  Defl:N      257  39% 08-21-2014 06:30 28d693c1  com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/Scanned.class
jira-greenhopper-plugin-7.13.0-DAILY20190329134024.jar:     731  Defl:N      394  46% 08-21-2014 06:30 345abc0d  com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/ConfluenceComponent.class
...
tomcat-filter-0.3.1.jar:       0  Stored        0   0% 06-21-2019 16:25 00000000  com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/
tomcat-filter-0.3.1.jar:     574  Defl:N      343  40% 05-14-2019 05:35 285fa055  com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/ClasspathComponent.class
tomcat-filter-0.3.1.jar:     728  Defl:N      396  46% 05-14-2019 05:35 6cd2cf1f  com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/BitbucketComponent.class
...
{code}
# Verify with the source code (pom.xml) which _atlassian-spring-scanner-annotation_ is used. 
#* In case of V1.x those files are expected 
#* In case of V2.x mentioned plugin will cause the problem, in this specific case - tomcat-filter-0.3.1.jar.
fields.summary: Jira fails to start plugins due to spring scanner library v.2 in greenhopper plugin

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

When configuring swimlanes in a board, the JQL and the Description fields are narrow: they don't use the entire space available and they can't be adjusted/expanded to use the full width available.

h3. +Environment+

Reproduced on Chrome, Firefox and Safari while using Jira 8.4.2.

h3. +Steps to reproduce+

# Install Jira Software 8.4.2
# Create a new Jira Software project using the Scrum template
# Open any board and go to *Board > Configure > Swimlanes*
# Change the setting *Base Swimlanes on* to *Queries*

h3. +Observed behavior+

The JQL and Description fields can't be expanded to use the full width available:
 !Jira842.png|thumbnail! 

h3. +Expected behavior+

The JQL and Description fields are using the full width available and can also be adjusted, like it was the case on previous Jira versions (for example 8.1.0):
 !Jira810.png|thumbnail! 


h3. +Workaround+

None
fields.summary: The width of some fields in the Board's swimlane configuration is narrow and can't be adjusted
